author: Staff Reporter
text:
Johnson P. Jose (35), Managing Director of city-based online trading firm Orion Broking Services Indian (P) Ltd, who was booked by the Coimbatore City Police in August 2015 for allegedly cheating thousands of customers was arrested by the police at Gundlupet, in Karnataka, on Tuesday.

Johnson, his wife Jincy Jose, vice-chairman of the firm Jose, and staff were booked under section 120B (punishment for criminal conspiracy), 409 (criminal breach of trust by public servant, or by banker, merchant or agent) and 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) of Indian Penal Code.

The case was transferred to the Crime Branch CID (CB-CID) police last year as the firm had customers in other cities and States, who were also cheated by the firm.

Custody sought

On Tuesday a special team of the CB-CID led by inspector Umapathy arrested Johnson and produced him before the Chief Judicial Magistrate here. On Wednesday the police filed a petition before the court seeking custody to inquire him.

He was arrested

by the CB-CID police at

Gundlupet in Karnataka
title: Prime accused in stock broking scam held
